Pre-Game Insights: Both Bahrain and Malaysia come into this AFC Asian Cup tie on the back of defeats.
Bahrain were handed a 3-1 defeat by South Korea while Malaysia faced a 4-0 defeat against table toppers Jordan.
Bahrain's forward Abdullah Al-Hashash was their best player in the opening match against South Korea, scoring Bahrain’s lone goal.
Malaysia's Junior Eldstal was one of the few positives from Malaysia’s opener against Jordan, making important clearances and crucial tackles.
Malaysia have not managed to defeat Bahrain since 1978.
Bahrain are ranked 86th while Malaysia stand at the 130th position in the latest FIFA rankings.
Bahrain’s Abdulla Yusuf Helal and Malaysia’s Mohamadou Sumareh were on the scoresheet the last time these two teams met.
Both teams are expected to have a fully fit squad available for selection going into this game.

Predicted line-up for Bahrain: Sayed Mohammed Jaffer (GK) (C); Mohamed Adel, Amine Mohamad Hassan Benaddi, Waleed Al Hayam, Abdulla Al Khalasi; Mohamed Al-Hardan; Ali Madan, Moses Atede, Jasim Khelaif Wahab Al Salama, Kamil Al Aswad; Abdulla Yusuf Helal.
Predicted line-up for Malaysia: Hazmi, Cools, Eldstal, Davies, Hanapi, Fazail, Wilkin, Corbin-Ong, Akhyar, Josue, Abdul Halim.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kick Off: January 20, 2024, 20:00 IST; January 20, 2024, 22:30 GMT+8; January, 20, 2024, 17:30 GMT+3.

Telecast for Bahrain vs Malaysia: India – Sports 18, Jio Cinema; Qatar, Bahrain, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Palestine, Syria, Yemen, Oman – BeinSports, Alkass; United Kingdom, Ireland, France, Belgium, Netherlands – Triller TV; Australia – Network 10; Malaysia – Astro Go, RTM.
